poem:
Title: "In the Echoes of Allegation"

They dance in the streets of Pakistan,
inebriation of paper ballots and cries,
Khan's party, a new sun dawned,
But with a surprise casting shadow.
Silhouettes of the powerful military,
loom like an ominous cloud,
Vote-rigging whispers caught in the gust,
flowing over a landscape of democracy.
Yet, amid chaos blossoms hope,
in the heart of the nation, ever-ripe.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Protests take place across Pakistan amid election vote-rigging allegations Protests have broken out across Pakistan amid allegations of widespread vote-rigging targeting the former prime minister Imran Khan’s political party and other nationalist groups in the country’s general election. The results of the election, which took place on Thursday, gave a surprise first place to Khan’s Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party, which won the most seats despite facing a stringent crackdown by the country’s powerful military establishment.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
